ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine continued on his way back to the Ark. his senses were good enough to protect him until he got back. he was still a long way from home, and knew he

Subject: He keeps goin and going and (Well you get the idea.)

Lunarpine continued on his way back to the Ark. his senses were good 
enough to protect him until he got back. he was still a long way from 
home, and knew he still might not make it. his comm was still down, 
and his internal computer still wasn't talking to him. he passed a 
small stream, he stopped to rest. The Maximal had to do something to 
keep his strength up. he had to transform and conserve energy.

Lunarpine transformed to his Wolf mode and began to drink from the 
stream.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Darkness had fallen on the land, the moon shown brightly over him, 
> Lunarpine could feel his solar converters beginning to work. he was 
> getting stronger, his internal systems had repaired the mech fluid 
> leaks so he wasn't going to slip into stasis. He didn't want to 
> chance transforming to wolf for fear he wouldn't have the energy to 
> change back if he had to fight. landmarks were beginning to look 
> familiar so he knew he was headed in the right direction. He had a 
> long walk ahead of him.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Lunarpine's optics came back online first, he could see the 
setting 
> sun and
> > the rising moon, he could feel his systems slowly coming back 
> online, he
> > could hear static in his ears and through his comm, his internal 
> repair
> > system was working it's magic, slowly he was regaining power.
> > 
> > He tried to pull himself to his feat, big mistake, his left arm 
> collapsed
> > beneath him. pain receptors were deffinately online. He used his 
> right arm
> > to get back on his feat, it was only a matter of time before the 
> pred
> > realized it was duped and returned. He had to move himself, at 
> least until
> > repairs were complete to his comm. He started walking, he just 
> hoped it was
> > the right direction.
> > 
> > 
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: <cyberwolf4@p...>
> > To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Wednesday, August 02, 2000 4:43 AM
> > Subject: Re: my last post for tonight
> > 
> > 
> > > Lunarpine awoke seated next to the stasis pod. he was week, but 
> still
> > > functioning. "Computer report." There was no answer. his power 
> levels
> > > were so low that his internal computer had shut itself off. He 
> was in
> > > bad shape.
> > >
> > > A whineing sound came from the pod, DNA scan complete, no 
> compatable
> > > lifeforms. Protoform not systemized for replication.
> > >
> > > "Of course it's not, it's splattered all over the ground." 
> Lunarpine
> > > was tired of hearing the pods scanner so he raised his hand and
> > > slapped the control.
> > >
> > > Malfunction
> > >
> > > BOOM
> > >
> > > The control panel exploded sending him about 30 feet through 
the 
> air,
> > > crashing through the tall grass to the hard ground below. 
> Lunarpines
> > > sensors flashed dark and he passed out.
> > >
> > > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > > > OOC:( the sabertooth tiger attacked the pod and knocked it 
over.
> > > > That would have caused more damage to the pod. Just keep that 
in
> > > mind)
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > > > > Lunarpine found his way back to the stasis pod. he fumbled 
> around
> > > > > returning the circuitry he'd removed until he got a slight 
> power
> > > > > reading. The wolfbot hooked himself up hopeing that the pod 
> had
> > > > > enough energy to sustain him. He hoped that the pod would 
> emit a
> > > > > strong enough reading to attract Maximals. He hoped that 
> they'd
> > > > pick
> > > > > up the signal before the Preds.
> > >
> > >
> > > 
> > >
